nomenclature.name: Ammandra decasperma
nomenclature.author: O.F.Cook
nomenclature.type: Colombia. Valle del Cauca: Buenaventura, 26 May 1926 (♂); Cook and Baker; 153

synonymy.name: Phytelephas decasperma
synonymy.author: (Cook) Dahlgren
synonymy.bibref: (Cook) Dahlgren, Field Mus. Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser. 14: 231, 1936.

div.p: Pacific Colombia from Valle del Cauca to Choco and Antioquia.
Flowering probably occurs throughout the year peaking during the wettest season from November to January. A locally common species occurring scattered in undisturbed, perhumid forest types.

Similar to A. dasyneura except as follows: surface of staminate peduncle pulveraceous, splitting in transverse striae upon drying; staminate receptacle conspicuously edged by mutual pressure, stamens 300-500, scattered, less than 1 mm long; filament 0.1-0.2 mm long; anther rounded, about 0.5 mm long and usually without connective.
